definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Thaksin and his wife, Pojaman, were in Beijing until Sunday for the opening of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫妇在北京参加奥运开幕式，一直逗留到星期天。

sentences.english: The convention starts September 1 in St. Paul, Minnesota.
sentences.chinese: 大会定于9月1日在明尼苏达州圣保罗市开幕。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony of the New York branch of CCB was held on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 中国建设银行纽约分行开幕仪式在星期五举行。

sentences.english: The school had been opened only last year by the agent to the governor-general .
sentences.chinese: 这所学校是去年由英属领地总督的代理人主持开幕的。

sentences.english: The balance shall be paid 45 days before the opening of the trade fair.
sentences.chinese: 剩余展位费在博览会开幕前45天内付清。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony was moderated by Du Qinglin, Minister of Agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式由农业部部长杜青林主持。

sentences.english: What's the start date of the Asian Gamess?
sentences.chinese: 广州亚运会的开幕日期是几月几日？

sentences.english: Sanmen Gorge Saige computer city when opens?
sentences.chinese: 三门峡赛格电脑城何时开幕？

sentences.english: Did you come early enough for the chairman's opening speech?
sentences.chinese: 你是早在主席致开幕词前就来了的吗？

sentences.english: The Opening Ceremony of the Universiade is in Nanshan District.
sentences.chinese: 大运会开幕式在南山区。

sentences.english: You don't have to wear swallowtail for the semiformal opening party.
sentences.chinese: 你不必穿燕尾服参加半正式的开幕酒会。

sentences.english: Today was the grand opening and Karla and Melanie were lost .
sentences.chinese: 今天才刚隆重开幕，卡拉和梅拉妮也在里面迷路了。

sentences.english: Comrade Yang delivered the opening speech.
We would like take the opportunity to thanks Y. B Wong Hong Wei for his presence to officially launched the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我们想借此机会感谢拿督王汉伟亲临及开幕此展览会。

sentences.english: What is that like to see Yao carry the flag.
sentences.chinese: 你看到姚明在开幕式举旗进场时感觉怎样？

sentences.english: Traditionally, eight people carry in the flag at the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 传统上，在开幕典礼上会有八个人运送旗帜进入会场。

definition: the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
